WorkItem.Description:
<!DOCTYPE svg PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD SVG 1.1//EN" "http://www.w3.org/Graphics/SVG/1.1/DTD/svg11.dtd">
<svg version="1.1" id="Layer_1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" x="0px" y="0px"
	 width="595px" height="595px" viewBox="0 0 595 595" enable-background="new 0 0 595 595" xml:space="preserve">
<g>
	<radialGradient id="SVGID_1_" cx="422.4502" cy="-35.7002" r="556.4982" gradientUnits="userSpaceOnUse">
		<stop  offset="0" style="stop-color:#FFFFFF"/>
		<stop  offset="0.1151" style="stop-color:#FDFEFA"/>
		<stop  offset="0.2592" style="stop-color:#F6FAEA"/>
		<stop  offset="0.4187" style="stop-color:#EAF4D1"/>
		<stop  offset="0.5894" style="stop-color:#DAEBAD"/>
		<stop  offset="0.769" style="stop-color:#C6DF7F"/>
		<stop  offset="0.9534" style="stop-color:#ADD248"/>
		<stop  offset="1" style="stop-color:#A6CE39"/>
	</radialGradient>
	<rect fill-rule="evenodd" clip-rule="evenodd" fill="url(#SVGID_1_)" width="595" height="595"/>
 
</g>
</svg>
 
The above svg code should render with a green background and a white to green gradient centered in the top right. Bur the colours are inverted and there is no nackground color!
